intro: Elaeodendron keniense, commonly known as Kenyan elaeodendron, is a rare evergreen tree native to the coastal regions of Kenya. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal forests and sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
